item.title: Hotfix #71 (1.8.3) - Patch Notes
item.description:
Hey Everyone, 

Hotfix #71 (1.8.3) is currently rolling out across our platforms. In the meantime, you can read the notes below.

To stay consistent with how Arbites cosmetics have been presented to players, we’ve deployed a fix for an issue introduced with Hotfix #70 where precinct decals were incorrectly appearing on them. With Hotfix #71 the intended decal behavior will be the following:

  • All progression gear upper bodies will display the selected precinct number. The upper body of the deluxe edition will remain unchanged. 

  • The cape in the Deluxe edition of the Arbites DLC will not display a precinct number.

  • Earnable in-game cosmetics that include capes will not show a precinct number on capes.

  • The Arbitrator Revelatum Plate with Covert Ops Coat (Lucis) in the Commodore's Vestures will not display the precinct number on the right shoulder anymore - to stay consistent with how the cosmetic was presented to players.

General Fixes

  • Upgraded to the latest version of FSR (3.1.4). 

  • Fixed an issue where Basic Training rewards preview images were displayed in an incorrect size.

  • Fixed an issue where backstory choices were randomized at the start of an operation in the Barber-Chirurgeon instead of using the player saved backstory.

  • Fixed an issue with the ‘Chained Deathblow’ Turtolsky Heavy Sword blessing where the critical chance bonus would not scale correctly on all tiers.

  • Additional fixes for a crash that could occur when Auspex devices started playing sounds the same time as the player wielded a weapon.

  • Fixed an issue that was causing the server to crash when players would step in specific locations in several missions.

Cosmetic & Animation Fixes

  • Fix for the Veteran “Regimental Beret” headgear cosmetic causing part of hairline to be hidden.  

  • Fixed an issue where some headgear cosmetics would cause the hairline of the characters to break.

Arbites Fixes & Tweaks

General Fixes & Tweaks

  • Lowered requirements for some Arbites Penances:

    • 'Justice Dispensed' from 3500 to 750

    • 'Arbites Gunner' from 3500 to 2000

    • 'Castigator's Arrest' from 3500 to 2000

  • Fixed an issue where sound was not playing correctly when the Nuncio Aquila ability expired.

  • Fixed an issue where some enemies were getting deformed when pounced on by the Cyber-Mastiff.

  • Smoke-emitting VFX are now enabled again for Cyber-Mastiff cosmetics displaying said effects.

  • Fixed an issue where 'Remote Detonation' could trigger Ranged Attack bonuses (e.g. the ‘Puncture’ weapon blessing).

  • Fixed an issue where blood effects were not being applied on the Shock Maul and Suppression Shield head.

  • Fixed an issue where 'Prosecution Blow' didn't apply correctly.

  • Fixed an issue where the ‘Pinpointing Target’ blessing would not trigger on the Shotpistol and Riot Shield.

  • Inspiring Recitation now correctly applies the intended 30% damage reduction, as stated in its description.

  • Fixed ‘Castigator's Stance’ not replenishing Toughness on activation while standing on fire surfaces.

  • Fixed an issue where players couldn't tag enemies in certain cases while using the double tag setting.

  • Fixed an issue where enemies tagged with ‘Execution Order’ would stay tagged even when not relevant to the mission anymore.

We’ll see you on the Mourningstar. 

– The Darktide Team

item.title: Korean added to supported languages at launch
item.description:
We’re very pleased to announce that Team MoDakBul, who provided post-launch Korean localisation for the first game, will be providing their services once again for Mechanicus II.

Big thanks to both Team MoDakBul and our Korean-speaking players for your support. We’re excited to make Mechanicus II more accessible to even more of you on day one!

item.title: Update 1.4.0.200 is out
item.description:
Lord Captains!

A patch for Warhammer 40000: Rogue Trader has arrived for PC. We’ve addressed the blocking issue that might occur in Act IV for some players with the Arbites origin.

Please be aware of the plot spoilers below!

Note that https://steamcommunity.com/app/2186680/discussions/0/4027970580228219058/ always contains up-to-date information on known issues and the roadmap of upcoming patches.

Patch Notes:

  • After speaking with Proctor Adriana Yeager in Act IV, further plot progress could become blocked for the players with the Adeptus Arbites origin in some cases – fixed. If you experienced this bug, speak to Adriana Yeager and then to Clerk Tertius Quart to advance in the quest.

item.title: Update 1.4.0.199 is live!
item.description:
Update 1.4.0.199 is live! The Heartless now becomes available instantly, multiple commonly reported bugs have been fixed, and inactive weapon sets no longer contribute to the character stats!

Please be aware of the plot spoilers below!

Note that https://steamcommunity.com/app/2186680/discussions/0/4027970580228219058/ always contains up-to-date information on known issues and the roadmap of upcoming patches.

Patch Notes:

  • Based on player feedback, the Heartless, new escort ship from Lex Imperialis, will now appear instantly rather than after finishing repairs in Act IV. Its stats will be a bit lower while in Act II, to represent its damaged state;
  • It is no longer possible to land on Thassera without Solomorne under certain circumstances;
  • Solomorne no longer inserts himself into some dialogues when he’s not in the party;
  • Fixed cases of incorrect behavior of Precognition ability that would sometimes prevent the player from ending the turn;
  • Fixed severe FPS drop caused by unexpected interaction between Relentless Blaze and Will to Live. Also fixed Relentless Blaze not counting Soul Burn as burning;
  • Fixed desyncs caused by saving during the preparation round;
  • Inactive weapon sets no longer provide the weapon bonuses to characters in addition to the active set bonuses.

item.title: Patch Notes 8.1
item.description:
Hello Space Marines,

The 8.1 Hotfix is now live on every platform. It fixes various crashes and connectivity issues, as well as a bug preventing the Helmet reward for Siege Mode to unlock.

  • Fixed several crashes

  • Fixed several issues causing disconnects

  • Fixed Siege Mode rewards from wave 25+

  • Lots of small fixes to Siege Mode map geometry

  • Fixed bug that was causing random enemies to get stronger much faster in infinite waves, causing one shot deaths randomly (Note: enemies are still going to get stronger but it will be not random and more consistent)

  • Fixed a bug in Siege Mode that occurred when a player would join a game in progress, the game would not apply difficulty modifiers correctly.

  • Fixed a bug in UI that was causing inability to change colour presets

  • Minor localization fixes
